name: Dragonborn
shortDesc: The clan is more important that life itself. They owe their devotion and respect to their clan above all else, even the gods. Continuous drive for self-improvement reflects the self-sufficiency of the race as a whole. They recognize that help is sometimes needed in difficult situations.

traits.commonAlign: Dragon born tend to extremes and make a concious choice for one side or the other in the cosmic war between good and evil. Most dragonborn are good.
traits.features: Breath Weapon, Draconic Ancestry and Damage Resistance

name: Dwarf
shortDesc: Short and stout, bold and hardy, dwarves are known as skilled warriors, miners and workers of stone and metal. Dwarves who take up the adventuring life may be motivated by a desire for treasure; others are driven by inspiration or command of a deity or seek to climb their clan’s hierarchy. They are slow to trust elves, halflings and humans.

traits.commonAlign: Most dwarves are lawful and tend toward good
traits.features: Darkvision, Dwarven Resilience, Dwarven Combat Training, Stonecunning, and Tool Proficiency

Hill Dwarves.summary: Keen senses, deep intuition and remarkable resilience

Mountain Dwarves.summary: Accustomed to a difficult life in rugged terrain

name: Elf
shortDesc: Slender and graceful, unearthly grace and fine features.  With a timeless perspective, more often amused than excited and more likely to be curious than greedy.

traits.commonAlign: Elves lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They are more often good then not, with the exception of the Drow. Drow are usually evil and vicious.
traits.features: Trance, Darkvision, Keen Senses, Fey Ancestry

High Elf.summary: Keen mind and a mastery of basic magic
High Elf.features: Elf Weapon Training, Cantrip, Extra Language

Wood Elf.summary: Keen senses and intuition, swift feet carry you quickly and stealthily through native woods.
Wood Elf.features: Elf Weapon Training, Feet of Foot, Mask of the Wild

Dark Elf.summary: Rare and does not exist in all worlds.
Dark Elf.features: Superior Darkvision, Sunlight Sensitivity, Drow Magic, Drow Weapon Training

name: Gnome
shortDesc: A gnome’s energy and enthusiasm for living shines through every inch of his or her tiny body. Gnomes speak as if they can’t get the thoughts out of their heads fast enough.

traits.commonAlign: Gnomes are mostly good. Those who lean towards lawful are sages, engineers, scholars, or investigators. Those who lean towards chaos are tricksters, wanderers, minstrels, or fanciful jewelers.

Forest Gnome.summary: Rare and secretive, you have a natural knack for illusion and inherent quickness and stealth.
Forest Gnome.features: Natural Illusionist, Speak with small beasts

Rock Gnomes.summary: Most common, you have a natural inventiveness and hardiness.

name: Half-Elf
shortDesc: Walking in two worlds but truly belonging to neither, half-elves combine what some say are the best qualities of their elf and human parents: human curiosity, inventiveness, and ambition tempered by the refined senses, love of nature, and artistic tastes of the elves.

traits.abilScore: +2 Charisma and +1 to two other abilities of your choice
traits.lang: Common, ELvish, and one extra language of your choice
traits.commonAlign: Because half-elves value both personal freedom and creative expression, they tend to be more chaotic.
traits.Features: Darkvision, Skill Versatility and Fey Ancestry

name: Half-orc
shortDesc: Some half-orcs rise to become proud chiefs of orc tribes, their human blood giving them an edge over their full-blooded orc rivals. Some venture into the world to prove their worth among humans and other more civilized races. Many of these become adventurers, achieving greatness for their mighty deeds and notoriety for their barbaric customs and savage fury.

traits.commonAlign: Half-orcs inherit a tendency towards chaos and are not strongly inclined towards good.
traits.Features: Darkvision, Menacing, Relentless Endurance, Savage Attacks

name: Halfling
shortDesc: Small and practical, kind and Curious they are adebt at fitting into a community of humans, dwarves or elves.

Lightfoot.summary: You can easily hide from notice, even using other people as cover.

Stout.summary: Hardier than average and have resistance to poison. Stronghearted.

name: Human
shortDesc: They are the most adaptable and ambitious people among the common races. Widely varying tastes, morals, and customs in many different lands where they have settled. They are also more physically diverse than other common races.

traits.lang: Common and one extra language of your choice
traits.commonAlign: Humans tend towards no particular alignment.

Calishite.summary: Shorter and slighter in build than most other humans, they have dusky brown skin, hair, and eyes.

Chondathan.summary: Slender, tawny-skinned folk with brown hair that ranges from almost blonde to almost black. Most are tall and have green or brown eyes.

Damaran.summary: Moderate of height and build with skin hues ranging from tawny to fair. Their hair is usually brown or black, and their eye color varies widely, though brown is most common.

Illuskan.summary: Tall, fair-skinned folk with blue or steely grey eyes. Most have raven-black hair.

Mulan.summary: Generally tall, slim, and amber-skinned with eyes of hazel or brown. Their hair ranges from black to dark brown, but nobles and many others shave off all their hair.

Rashemi.summary: Tend to be short, stout, and muscular. They usually have dusky skin, dark eyes, and thick black hair.

Shou.summary: Yellowish-brown in hue with black hair and dark eyes.

Tethyrian.summary: Medium build and height with dusky skin that tends to grow fairer the farther north they live. Theis hair and eye color varies widely, but brown hair and blue eyes are the most common.

Turami.summary: Generally tall and muscular with dark mahogany skin, curly black hair, and dark eyes.

name: Tiefling
shortDesc: Tieflings are derived from human bloodlines. Their infernal heritage has left a clear imprint on their appearance. Lacking a homeland, tieflings have to make their own way in the world and have to be strong to survive. They are not quick to trust anyone who claims to be a friend, but when a tiefling’s companions demonstrate that they trust him or her, the tiefling learns to extend the same trust to them. Once a tiefling gives someone loyalty, they are a firm friend or ally for life.

traits.Features: Darkvision, Hellish Resistance and Infernal Legacy
